com.example.gabriella.wanderlust

Class RVAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<RVAdapter.TravelViewHolder>
      • com.example.gabriella.wanderlust.RVAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class RVAdapter
extends android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<RVAdapter.TravelViewHolder>
implements java.io.Serializable

    RVAdapter

    Adapter that follows the view holder design pattern and reuses the card view layout (item.xml). The class is used for displaying the user's coming travels in a CardView/RecycleView.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Gabriella Thor√©n
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • onBindViewHolder

        public void onBindViewHolder(RVAdapter.TravelViewHolder travelViewHolder,
                    int position)
        Specifies the contents of each item of the RecyclerView. Sets the values of the title, days, and background fields of the CardView.
        Specified by:
        onBindViewHolder in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<RVAdapter.TravelViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        travelViewHolder - the holder of the CardView and its components
        position - the position of the item in the list of DBTravel, which is shown in the layout
        Throws:
        java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
        See Also:
        DBTravel, DBTravel.getTravelID(), DBUser

      • onCreateViewHolder

        public RVAdapter.TravelViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(android.view.ViewGroup viewGroup,
                                            int i)
        This method is called when the ViewHolder needs to be initialized. The method sets the layout to the item layout, which is the layout for every row in the CardView, to the activity.
        Specified by:
        onCreateViewHolder in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<RVAdapter.TravelViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        viewGroup - the view group of the layout
        i - the position of the item (travel) in the list
        Returns:
        A new ViewHolder that holds a View of the given view type.
        See Also:
        RecyclerView.Adapter.getItemViewType(int), #onBindViewHolder(ViewHolder, int)
